### Method 1
This method checks if the string starts with "--" or "-" and removes it if it does. This method is not likely to cause a bug because it only removes leading hyphens and does not affect the functionality of the program if it is not present.

### Method 2
This method checks if the string starts with a quote and ends with a quote and removes them if they are present. This method is likely to cause a bug if the string is not enclosed in quotes. If the string is not enclosed in quotes, the method will remove the first character and potentially leave the rest of the string unprocessed.

### Method 3
This method is a copy of Method 2. It's likely to cause a bug if the string is not enclosed in quotes. If the string is not enclosed in quotes, the method will remove the first character and potentially leave the rest of the string unprocessed.
